While the ones that actually attacked police officers are pardoned and compensation of millions paid.

posts.title: Shipment of thousands of chicks left in USPS truck. Overwhelmed shelter needs help adopting them
top_comments:
This is brutal.

>A Delaware animal shelter is trying to care for and rehome thousands of chicks that survived being left in a postal service truck for three days. **Trapped in a warm enclosure, without food and water, thousands died before they were discovered on May 2**, [CBS affiliate WBOC](https://www.wboc.com/news/delaware-shelter-caring-for-thousands-of-birds-after-shipping-mishap/article_002f58bc-db85-4203-99af-0a2a363308cf.html) reported.

>Some have inquired about buying the birds for meat, but, as a no-kill shelter and SPCA, those were refused.

I've got just under a hundred assorted breeds that are free to come and go as they please. I keep them solely for the eggs, the company (plus they make good sentries for my other critters re predators etc) and because they eat bugs. But almost all my chickens eventually die of old age. 

Just sayin, chickens are pretty awesome.
Horrible timeline for eyes, ears, and a heart

I ordered several turkey poults one year and a snow storm hit. They sat on an unheated truck for an extra day. I lost so many, it was truly devastating. 

I only buy hatching eggs now. I’ll never order live chicks again. I don’t know how some do it. It just feels so inhumane to do that to the poor birds. They can’t control their environment at all.
We have 8 chicks in the hands of USPS as we speak. We will be first time chicken parents. This isn’t exactly encouraging.
Oh geez, one of my good friends has a farm in the area — texting her to see if they can take some of them in.
Humans really suck, huh

I don't understand how this happens. I worked for fedex for a time, at a ramp that saw lots of different live animals in conveyance, including often hundreds, and sometimes thousands of chicks in a day. The live animals are checked by 3 parties wherever they move on property, including usps, especially if held at the end and beginning of each work day, excluding multiple people in management who also took concern to make sure those boxes were checked. Unfortunately, there are sometimes a dozen or more DoA anyway from chicks escaping mid flight -probably 10% of all the flights inbound with lives in the aft cargo- but nothing compared to this. A shame those customers also probably just reordered the chicks on insurance or something and just rejected the order of "defective chicks to die or try to be rescued by someone else.
On LaJoy's watch? Color me shocked...

> Some have inquired about buying the birds for meat, but, as a no-kill shelter and SPCA, those were refused.

This seems like a pointless line drawn in the sand.

Please add AI-generated photos that are in poor taste to the bill. So the world sees less of them om his socials.
I'm guessing to crack down on videos he doesn't like.  But videos from him will be legal

C'mon!

Who did that Gaza Trump/Musk promotion vid? 

Can't "crack down" on one with out cracking down on all.
He’s gonna use it to force removal of anything online he doesn’t like.

Note that this will affect more than explicit deepfakes. There are no provisions against using this law in bad faith. Trump has [already said](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/03/trump-calls-congress-pass-overbroad-take-it-down-act-so-he-can-use-it-censor) that he will take advantage of this law to censor online speech critical of him. The EFF is [opposed to it](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/04/congress-passes-take-it-down-act-despite-major-flaws) for numerous reasons.
You mean he wants the government to have a monopoly on disinformation.

posts.title: Regeneron to buy bankrupt DNA testing firm 23andMe for $256 million
top_comments:
Delete Your Data From 23andMe

https://www.nytimes.com/wirecutter/reviews/wirecutter-show-podcast-20250328-23andme-data-bankrupt/
Can't wait to fight my genetically upgraded evil clone, designed to replace me!!

$256 million/15 million customers = $17.

Your DNA is worth $17.

IMO the biggest miss with 23&Me is them not buying Ancestry.com, etc, to help build a collaborative genealogical chart system families could use and edit, or expanding on it with local family related news and documents available throughout the generations to better piece together familial history and even photos, etc.

Aside from selling biological info to ad companies or insurers or other seedy profiteers, I don’t see why they couldn’t have made money from a reduced priced option for current members / entrants to access the “plus” member benefits or used the genetic data and self reports, combined with localized double blind studies ofc, to confirm data trends that could be profitable while also not selling discreet information.

I feel like they just didn’t broaden the definition of what was possible under their company’s umbrella.

I am a former Regeneron employee (retired).  I can say they are not buying the failing business. They are buying the genetic database to use in the development of new monoclonal antibody therapeutic proteins.  There is an arms race to get to good candidates first to stake out patents to prevent competitors access to whole categories of potential therapies. They have lost several lawsuits to others who got there first metaphorically speaking.  They have technology to rapidly test candidates with Velocogene and could theoretically get dozens of billion dollar drugs from this dataset without any patent fights. The money spent is peanuts to its potential value.  While I am not a huge fan of the cost of these therapies , I personally know the tens to hundreds of thousands of man hours that go into developing these drugs, and they can be astonishingly effective.  It’s not popular to say you worked in big pharma but I’m very proud of the work I did there and how it has affected patients, including members of my own extended family.
I never did a DNA test because I always felt it was going to be used for transactional reasons. This is exactly why; Your information is whoever buys it.

I sent my DNA in knowing all the pitfalls (to Ancestry, not 23andMe, but same thing) because I'm adopted and wanted to find my biological family. I actually found them, and now have a solid relationship with my full biological brother, which has been well worth any horrors that might occur from my DNA being in a database. Otherwise, I wouldn't do this.

Ok, I guess I need to brace for the downvotes given the current comments here. 

Honestly, this is worlds better than an insurance company or some random tech startup with undescribed end goals, guys. This is a legitimate big pharmaceutical company who has a lot of R&D around genetic disease and has made a lot of therapeutic advances. They want the data to develop new therapies, probably ones for genetic based disease. Being the first to do this will make them so much money. That’s their goal here, I think. It’s new massively growing space in R&D. And this much genetic data is research treasure trove for them.

They are also going to have pre-designed protocols and standards when it comes to handling this data. I know people side eye big pharma (rightfully in most circumstances) but this is a much better outcome than many other situations.

Am I saying don’t delete your data? No. Am I saying this is better than pretty much any other potential buyer? Absolutely.

I also want to add one thing: All the stuff about Trump ties is wild. Pretty much every pharma company (and  many of the academic researchers that Trump is now black listing from NIH funding due to their coronavirus research) got Project Warp Speed funding during the pandemic. Monoclonal antibody treatment was an absolute scientific miracle. So were the other rapid vaccine developments during the pandemic. It saved so many lives.
What are the downsides of them having our dna data. I keep seeing everyone saying delete it.

Forgive me for being dumb but isn't a drug maker buying 23 and me a good thing? 

I'm just happy it's not an insurance company so now this data can be used to actually help people.

It’s like Putin is in the white house and he’s just destroying as much as possible

This 4th of July will be no flag for me the country is dead and I am completely disgusted with so much about it , it makes me sick . My husband , a proud WWll vet , celebrated every year and I kept it up for him , but it is a total farce and I refuse to pretend .
Just as it was intended to
That's most likely the goal; to get them to leave.

Trump keeps losing in the courts because he is running out of lawyers. 

Malevolence tempered by incompetence.

posts.title: Alphabet's Waymo gets California nod for robotaxi expansion in San Francisco Bay Area
top_comments: Get ready for waymo Waymo taxis
They seem to be popping up in alot more places. Had to go to DC for work last week and I saw like 12 of them roaming the streets.
I’d love to take a driverless Waymo. That’s gotta be interesting. Probably a bit unnerving your first time.

This is what the techbros want to replace BART, and sadly a lot of the people in the bay area are receptive to the idea. People are mad that BART has been in decline for a while now, and they think that the best solution to that is to cut BART's funding. Of course, that will just make things worse, so the fantasy is that self-driving taxis will take its place as the primary "public transportation" system.

posts.title: Retired Navy Admiral Is Convicted on Bribery Charges
top_comments:
>> In a statement on Monday, Jeanine Pirro, the interim United States attorney for Washington, said that the verdict sent a message.

“When you abuse your position and betray the public trust to line your own pockets, it undermines the confidence in the government you represent,” Ms. Pirro said. “Our office, with our law enforcement partners, will root out corruption — be it bribes or illegal contracts — and hold accountable the perpetrators, no matter what title or rank they hold.”<<

**sigh**

Oh wow.  I assumed this would be another in the long line of Naval officers to fall prey to the wiles of Fat Leonard.  I guess the deterrent effect of that operation didn’t dissuade this admiral from taking the same bribery plunge as his fellow seamen.  Thank you for your service.  

Also it’s a real hoot to see a Pirro quote in a DOJ press release. This must be one of the first actions she’s been able to comment on!

So originally arrested under Biden. 


I was also surprised to read he wasn't part of the Pacific fleet and Fat Leonard.

Sadly he will probable get a slap on the wrist because of his rank. 

He should get jail, reduced rank and never be allowed to work with a government contractor ever again. 

It is amazing how greedy people can be. Making all that money as a 4 star officer and still looking for bribes.

That guy already had a fucking banger of a pension.

Oh well, play stupid games, win stupid prizes.  I hope he enjoys jail and the loss of his pension and medical benefits.
Tsk tsk tsk, if you want to take bribe you got to run for POTUS ma dude.

“I expect the evidence will show that Burke and others at the Navy misled Charlie and Meghan in material ways, and **they’re not liable for bribing the guy who lied to them**,” Mr. Brodsky said. 

\- The defense lawyer is stating publicly that his clients bribed the Admiral.

Must be new. Have to make sure to only accept planes. Or perhaps start a crypto coin where the highest donation gets to have dinner with you. No way they would charge you then.
The orange felon should face bribery charges

posts.title: Retired Navy Admiral Is Convicted on Bribery Charges
top_comments:
>> In a statement on Monday, Jeanine Pirro, the interim United States attorney for Washington, said that the verdict sent a message.

“When you abuse your position and betray the public trust to line your own pockets, it undermines the confidence in the government you represent,” Ms. Pirro said. “Our office, with our law enforcement partners, will root out corruption — be it bribes or illegal contracts — and hold accountable the perpetrators, no matter what title or rank they hold.”<<

**sigh**

Oh wow.  I assumed this would be another in the long line of Naval officers to fall prey to the wiles of Fat Leonard.  I guess the deterrent effect of that operation didn’t dissuade this admiral from taking the same bribery plunge as his fellow seamen.  Thank you for your service.

posts.title: Shipment of thousands of chicks left in USPS truck. Overwhelmed shelter needs help adopting them
top_comments:
This is brutal.

>A Delaware animal shelter is trying to care for and rehome thousands of chicks that survived being left in a postal service truck for three days. **Trapped in a warm enclosure, without food and water, thousands died before they were discovered on May 2**, [CBS affiliate WBOC](https://www.wboc.com/news/delaware-shelter-caring-for-thousands-of-birds-after-shipping-mishap/article_002f58bc-db85-4203-99af-0a2a363308cf.html) reported.

>Some have inquired about buying the birds for meat, but, as a no-kill shelter and SPCA, those were refused.

I've got just under a hundred assorted breeds that are free to come and go as they please. I keep them solely for the eggs, the company (plus they make good sentries for my other critters re predators etc) and because they eat bugs. But almost all my chickens eventually die of old age. 

Just sayin, chickens are pretty awesome.
Horrible timeline for eyes, ears, and a heart

I ordered several turkey poults one year and a snow storm hit. They sat on an unheated truck for an extra day. I lost so many, it was truly devastating. 

I only buy hatching eggs now. I’ll never order live chicks again. I don’t know how some do it. It just feels so inhumane to do that to the poor birds. They can’t control their environment at all.
We have 8 chicks in the hands of USPS as we speak. We will be first time chicken parents. This isn’t exactly encouraging.
Oh geez, one of my good friends has a farm in the area — texting her to see if they can take some of them in.
Humans really suck, huh

I don't understand how this happens. I worked for fedex for a time, at a ramp that saw lots of different live animals in conveyance, including often hundreds, and sometimes thousands of chicks in a day. The live animals are checked by 3 parties wherever they move on property, including usps, especially if held at the end and beginning of each work day, excluding multiple people in management who also took concern to make sure those boxes were checked. Unfortunately, there are sometimes a dozen or more DoA anyway from chicks escaping mid flight -probably 10% of all the flights inbound with lives in the aft cargo- but nothing compared to this. A shame those customers also probably just reordered the chicks on insurance or something and just rejected the order of "defective chicks to die or try to be rescued by someone else.
On LaJoy's watch? Color me shocked...

> Some have inquired about buying the birds for meat, but, as a no-kill shelter and SPCA, those were refused.

This seems like a pointless line drawn in the sand.
